description: Citizens gather in the streets demanding answers, while provisional guidelines are issued warning that services will remain unreliable. Trust in the Council continues to erode as calls for a new model of governance grow louder.

Lenart Kova accesses Halden’s sealed datacenter cache. He chooses to release Halden's spiral diagrams and assembly instructions to the public, prioritizing governance innovation over exposing past Council deceptions.
Copies of Halden’s spiral diagrams and guidelines for participatory assemblies circulate widely. Grassroots organizers set up open forums in city squares, attracting citizens eager for reform.
Spontaneous spiral-shaped assemblies fill public spaces. Participants openly debate BCI oversight, rights, and city governance, demanding systemic transparency and human oversight mechanisms.

Prominent facilitators, including previously erased citizens, help draft a "Spiral Constitution" in citywide assemblies. The document guarantees citizen oversight of BCI and regular open forums, advancing toward public ratification.
